description:
The Gastrea virus spreads like wildfire, causing each infected host to rapidly mutate, gaining new powers and abilities with every stage of development, even while they continue to attack, kill and infect multiple new hosts. Unable to fight a pandemic enemy that turns defenders into adversaries, the shocked remnants of the human race are forced to retreat into cities surrounded by giant monoliths made of Varanium, one of the few materials that can stop the Gastrea. Now mankind's last hope lies in the Cursed Children: young girls infected with the virus who have managed to retain a hold on their humanity. Paired with a partner, they alone have the strength to take on a Gastrea in one-on-one combat. But the very thing that gives them power is a ticking time bomb, so even as they protect humanity, they are also feared and shunned. Are they Girls? Monsters? Or Mankind's Ultimate Salvation?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: แบล็ค บุลเลท

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Pandemic
tags.description: Prominently features a disease prevalent over a whole country or the world.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

title.native: 天誅ガールズ「ミライ＊ガール」

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''

fripSide is a Japanese indie pop band. Started in 2002. They also have many other support members.  

On March 15, 2009, nao stated on the fripSide Official Website that she had graduated from fripSide. Sat and nao want to pursue different musical careers, as nao intends to pursue a solo singing career. Meanwhile Sat will continue in fripSide with a new project called, fripside: THE NEXT PROJECT. Seiyuu Yoshino Nanjo took over as the vocalist of fripSide with her debut single "only my railgun", the opening of the anime, To Aru Kagaku no Railgun. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members__
- sat - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (lyrics, synthesizers, composer, arrangement) (2002-present)
- Mao Uesugi (上杉真央) - (vocals) (2022-present)
- Hisayo Abe (阿部寿世) - (vocals) (2022-present)

__Former Members__
- [nao](https://anilist.co/staff/118365/nao) (vocal, lyrics) (2002-2009)
- [Yoshino Nanjo](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjo) (南條愛乃) - (vocals, lyrics) (2009-2022)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Siden_K)

__Date of Birth:__ August 1985
__Place of Birth:__ Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan
__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](http://ukaisaki.xxxxxxxx.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ukaisaki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=48456)

__Gender:__ Female
__Date of Birth:__ May 8
__Place of Birth:__ Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AmaaTodd)

Originating from [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently freelance.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
Debuted as an art director of [Kurau Phantom Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/483/).

The founder and CEO of Studio ORANGE. He began as freelance CG creator in the game industry, before switching to anime with 'Zoids: Chaotic Century‘ in 1999. Founded Studio ORANGE in 2004 after working on Shoji Kawamori's 'Aquarion'. He has worked as a 3D/CGI Director and/or Producer for shows from Madhouse, Xebec, Doga Kobo, Kinema Citrus, and Passione.
